questions.question_text: At what level is the ALLOW_CLIENT_MFA_CACHING parameter configurable in Snowflake?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/security-mfa
To enable MFA token caching, complete the following steps:

As an account administrator (i.e. a user with the ACCOUNTADMIN system role), set the ALLOW_CLIENT_MFA_CACHING parameter to true for an account using the ALTER ACCOUNT command.

Selected Answer: C
C - 90 sec + 60 sec (min value)

Selected Answer: C
The answer is C as anytime less then the first min is billed to the first min and then anytime beyond that is billed to second. https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/cost-understanding-overall

questions.question_text:
A size X-Small virtual warehouse ran for 90 seconds, and was shut down. The warehouse was then run for another 30 seconds before being shut down again.

How many seconds will be billed?
Which virtual warehouse configuration is recommended specifically for a steady workload that has no execution lag?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct restarting a suspended warehouses creates lags

Selected Answer: B
Per Snowflake docs - Setting AUTO_SUSPEND to 0 or NULL is not recommended, unless your query workloads require a continually running warehouse. Note that this can result in significant consumption of credits (and corresponding charges), particularly for larger warehouses. In this case it would be reasonable to do as the scenario calls out a continuous query load. https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/create-warehouse

Selected Answer: B
D is not related to execution without lag. The right answer is B.

Selected Answer: B
AUTO_SUSPEND = 0 means the virtual warehouse will not automatically suspend, making it ideal for a steady, uninterrupted workload. This configuration avoids execution lag caused by resuming a suspended warehouse.

questions.question_text: Which role allows a Snowflake user to view table-level storage utilization information from the TABLE_STORAGE_METRICS view by default?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
I have checked, as well, in snowflake, all C,D,E are working. For me, D was a surprise. I shall select C and E

Selected Answer: CE
Unfortunately C,D,E will work in Snowflake:

At the same time accorting to documentation Snowflake separates Dot and Bracket Notation, thst's why voting for C and E.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/querying-semistructured#traversing-semi-structured-data

Selected Answer: CD
I think C D
